title: About the new "Runes Reforged" system.
body:
Hi there Riot, I've been watching the stream, yet I wasn't able to get my question answered through the wall of text from Twitch chat, so I'll just post mine here.

So, do you think that this new system will dramatically shift the "meta", effectively bringing some out some of the less successful champions out of the woodwork, while booting some meta champions out?

I say this because i'm pretty sure that everyone is afraid (especially the mains who play mostly out of meta champions.) that their champions will be worse than it is, and maybe making them unplayable. I don't my fat fish to be a goner. {{champion:223}} 

And if this does happen, would you tweak the runes system more? Or re-balance some of the champions that have been boot of the meta?

Thank you for answering! (If you choose to do so!)

replies.body: Sorry we didn't get to your question, navigating the Twitch spam was tricky. We're expecting some degree of meta shift certainly, though trying to keep the game feeling pretty similar overall. There will almost certainly be some individual champions that get too strong off Runes, and some that struggle too much, and we're expecting we'll do a lot of balance work on the system both while it's on PBE and after it goes live. That will include both regular patches and likely some micro patches to respond to stuff quicker as well. Odds are we'll probably need to adjust mechanics on some individual runes too at some point if they're revealed to be too effective in some circumstances or just not very useful. Possible that even means replacing some, or, if the issue is that some champs just aren't catered to enough, adding additional ones in (3 per slot's not a maximum necessarily).

Meddler, you already screwed Nunu players once with the removal of Strength of Ages and the addition of Courage of the Colossus. Now Stoneborn is dropping to a standard rune and we're getting Aftershock.

Don't make us wait another year. Please. PLEASE, Meddler, what else do you want me to say? If you are so damn insistent that wardens and vanguards have immobilizing crowd control, give Nunu an immobilizing ability. Don't make us wait for the VGU team. You gave Draven a brand new passive after only a bit of PBE testing. The full VGU can take its time but give us a new ability to tide us over until then. There is no reason Nunu shouldn't be able to use Aftershock like all the other Vanguards and Wardens.

What are we supposed to do, Meddler? Please, respond to this. This is not a rhetorical question, I really want to have a discussion with you about this. You've done this twice now, so surely you have an explanation for yourselves this time.

You nerfed Nunu's health scaling right before you removed Strength of the Ages, do you remember that? Literally the patch before, when no one knew you were going to remove SotA. So you nerfed his health scaling and then immediately took away 300 health after that. And gave us something we literally couldn't use. 

Then there was like a five month period where Nunu just flat out did not have a keystone before you reworked Bond of Stone. Those were dark times, Meddler. And now they're rearing their head again.

What am I supposed to do? Tell me! I am **sick** and I am **tired** of playing Nunu like a juggernaut. He's not a juggernaut, Meddler! Why are you trying to force us to get Grasp of the Undying on a tank? Why are you trying to force us to look for ways to optimize in-combat sustain and damage to enemy champions on a tank, especially after the tank update where you refocused tank power into utility over damage. This is completely antithetical to everything 7.9 introduced.

And you nerfed Nunu's base stats twice this season because of his interactions with Cinderhulk. Now Nunu is losing Stoneborn Pact, and is he going to get some compensation for that? Probably not, but even if he does it won't make up for every champion in the game having a keystone but him. Why are you doing this a second time? Why?
